You make the call.7) The service was sluggish, but our waitress was pleasant enough, and she came to check on us a few times when she wasn't being hassled by the drunken birthday/orgy participants (seriously, the sounds they were making bordered on indecent. Is that allowed in restaurants? I'll have to try it sometime and see what happens).8) The bill was higher than it should have been, based on the quality of the food we received.Final verdict: has potential, but needs to step it up and work on their A-game in the kitchen. Will I be back? Maybe.
It's a little pricy but good service and good deals during happy hour. Liked the DJ and food was pretty good too. Good spot

Snotty staff.Apart from that, the food is good. I particularly enjoy their monday wings night. A couple of years ago it used to be free wings, with a minimum of two drinks. Nowadays it's $5 per person, with limited sitting, and still, a minimum of two drinks.Despite that I still find myself going there once in a while for some yummy wings (They offer three flavors: Teriyaki, which is very popular it seems, buffalo, and BBQ)
Service, food, cocktail, atmospheres everything was really good. It our first time and we are very happy. We got offered dessert on the house.
Nice place have been for brunch and dinner and have no complaints food and service were good. The wing night is a good deal!

Whenever I'm in doubt of where to go in Hoboken, I go here. Went on numerous occasions with friends and family and never left disappointed. The grilled salmon and tilapia are to die for. My mouth's watering just from thinking of those two dishes. The only thing about that is that there's a great budget-friendly daily menu and the salmon is only on Wednesdays. I think you can still get it, but I like good deals. The selection of wine is good and I almost prefer getting that instead of their mixed drinks. Don't get me wrong, those are amazing too, but a bit too strong for my taste. During the summer all bars in Hoboken can't have anyone sitting outside after 11pm (I'm guessing noise), so keep that in mind. All you have to do after 11 is take your drinks inside. Good spot!Minor thing: the bouncer asked my friend if were in the same age bracket after absolutely refusing to card her. In my book, that's not a very nice way to treat a perfectly nice and friendly customer who's bringing business to your bar.

Have you ever wanted to revisit the 90's or 70's???  If you'e answered "yes," then 10th and Willow is the place for you!If you're lucky enough to be able to grab dinner outside (I hope it's before 11pm), you can be whisked away to sweet memories of the year 1999 as the Dave Matthews cover band squawks away inside.  As you lose yourself in memories of the simpler times that Dave promotes, you get to watch the endless stream of 21-23 years olds float in and out of the bar drunkenly shouting to each other and trying to hit on one another in between cigarettes outside.  If this scene sounds boring to you, don't worry the best is yet to come!The manager will not disappoint his costumers by raising their dining experience to the highest level of dinner theatre.  He does this by trying to convince his customers it's 1975 and he's a mob boss.  If the showing off of his crucifix to his regulars isn't enough to make you roll your eyes and make you wish you had ordered Chinese, just wait. The endless stream of police cars stopping outside and shouting greetings will certainly convince you that you could soon be the victim of a drive by!I don't know about you, but any dining experience that allows me to watch the sad faded dreams of old men played out in front of me is enough for me to consider anorexia.  However, if you're down on yourself and want to geel better, then watching the scene at 10th and Willow on a Thursday night is certainly the place for you!
This is a nice and cozy place to just hang out and grab a drink, but I'm not sure what else you can/want to do here.

Stopped here for dinner on whim (cute outdoor patio!) visiting my sister in Hoboken. The menu was pretty pricey for dinner but it was half priced entrees so they were only $10-16, much more reasonable. I had the tilapia with rice for $14, I believe. It was a great portion of fish on rice with green beans. My sister had the fried chicken, my mom had the shrimp penne, and my lucky brother had the pizza. All of the food was enjoyed but the pizza was really good. We were all stealing it from him. Nothing looked as good coming out but I'm a pizza addict.The bread was one of the best parts of the meal, mainly because the butter was with cheese and jalepeno. It was sooo yummy and a great way to start the meal while waiting for our food. They also gave you plenty of water (and our waitress was very attentive). I didn't know what to expect from the atmosphere from the outside but it was really cute inside. There was a front bar area and then two separate sections. We were all the way in the back and it was cool and quiet. There were tons of "yuppie" business professionals in their twenties and thirties but I also saw people with little kids and older couples.

I am a constant take-out regular here...they're turkey burgers are amazing, and you can customize pretty much however you want, so it's a great easy dinner to pick up on the way home from work.Their calamari is also delicious, served with spicy italian peppers...Mmmm!I've also tried a couple of their specialty cocktails and been pleased with them all...The cucumber martini was delish!Small downside - takeout almost ALWAYS takes about 45 minutes (and that's usually an order for two)....but I just always call before I'm starving and it's perfect.Plus side to takeout! - They call your cell when your order is ready, so you don't have to get there early and stand around waiting like an idiot :)When we dine in, my boyfriend is a huge fan of the flavored butter, which is always changing...we've had sundried tomato, pepperoni, basil?....and more that I can't remember.Be careful when you go, as it gets crowded quickly on the weekends.  Sit in the back room if you want a more intimate dinner, the front room gets loud!A good spot to stop for a quick drink during the week (happy hour) or if you like a packed place, go on the weekend.

not impressed.very overpriced.food is so-so. pretty standard bar food with some pasta and steaks thrown on the menu...i have a strange suspicion they think they are doing something different and try to portray themselves as more upscale than they really are. it has that sort of pretentious vibe when it shouldn't!go for drinks, not worth spending the money on dinner.

If you're looking for a night out of neglect and disappointment, come here. Tonight was the first night I really believed in zombie existence. Not sure if the staff was on drugs or what, but maybe if I brought my fog horn I could've gotten attention - or at least a glass of wine I ordered 30 min prior. I come here on weekends often and the last two times I came for dinner, I wanted to slam my skull against the table to get someone to come over and take my drink order. After endless attempts at getting a glass of wine and a salad, I got both, I couldn't eat my meal because a loss of appetite from watching my server dig his fingers to claim an itch in the rear of his pants.

Now, this rating may be a bit lofty, but 10th is no less than 4 stars.  I give them 5 cause the owner gives me free shots just for being in there once in a while... Top shelf too.  Best wings in Hoboken.Great deals, best happy hour. Good cheap pizza.Decent burgers.  They're huge and need to be cut in half.Great brunch.Great mixologist.Great crowd.Great night life.Food is overall really good.Place is bigger than it looks. A bit pricey. 10th and Willow is overall top notch definitely one of the best in Hoboken.  Same league would be Anthony David's, and O'Neill's.

My wife and I have been going here for years. Great food and service.  We typically get the same things buffalo shrimp, steak salads, wine. The staff is great and now that we have an infant and a toddler, this has become our go to place for dinner out. They really go out of their way to make you feel comfortable.

10th & Willow one of those places where I have had one of those "the best thing I have ever eaten" type experiences. Great food, friendly staff and great service. Just about everything I have eaten here has been really really really good. The staff is accommodating, especially the owner who can often be found on site greeting the customers and making sure things run smooth. This is the kind of place you never get tired of and the food keeps you coming back. My favorite dishes are the Buffalo Shrimp, Teriyaki Wings and the French Burger.

This is one of my favorite places to go for either a low-key dinner or drinks (or better yet: BOTH).  As far as the bar scene, there is a live DJ on Fridays and Saturdays that plays your basic Top 40.  Fun martinis and shots.What I really love about this place is how easy it makes turning a random weeknight into an enjoyable evening.  Grab a table outside, order some wings and even bring your pooch if you so choose.  Relaxing atmosphere and the food is surprisingly decent for what you would expect would be standard bar food.

Tenth and willow is easily my favorite restaurant/bar in Hoboken! The food is phenomenal and the service is even better. I highly recommend the spinach artichoke dip  for an appetizer and for an entree I'd go with the philly cheesesteak, but you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Tenth and willow also has some great drink specials including $2 coors lights! Highly recommend going to tenth and willow for any occasion dinner, brunch, or drinks on a friday or saturday night!

They serve the best wings and burgers in Hoboken. We went in for drinks and food on a lazy Sunday - service and food were both great. We ordered delivery for a Saturday night, and the food came quickly and was also very good. Would highly recommend.
Food is very good as is the cool atmosphere.  The owner was very friendly and made sure we had a good seat.  Drinks are a bit over priced but one of my favorite Hoboken haunts

The service at this place is horrible!!!  This is the third time that I try going to this place and ask myself why!  The food is not great, the service is horrible!!!!! and unless you are in the main bar room, the other rooms do not have great access to TVs.  The Managers and hostess at this place is just insanely RUDE!
went here for all u can eat wings once and they were cold. I've yet to try them at a regular dinner time but I want to see how it is

I can't believe how crappy the food is here. Absolutely disgusting.  I think they water down the drinks too. What a joke. How has the health department passed them. I had an eggs Benedict and the eggs were still raw

Went here recently with my friend she lives in the area but never knew about the all you can eat wings. Updating my review since  I haven't been here in a while.  Since the weather was nice we decided we would give 10th & Willow a try. . Checked the website to see if the deal is still ongoing. On the website it reads:  all you can eat wings $5.00 from 11am to 11pm. I thought to myself damn good deal.  Upon entering the Bouncer gave me ice stare as if he was Marco from Tropoja, like the movie "Taken". He didn't crack a smile. Is he a mercenary something?Bouncer: Dining in or WingsMe: WingsBouncer: (Stares at me even harder) - Two drink Minimum also Me: Like a comedy club right lolBouncer.  (Stares at me even harder) I know this is what he was thinking "Your little quips or jokes are not funny". Me: Dang. I hand him my left wrist  Bouncer: (Stares at me even harder) Wrong wrist, I need the rightThen he instructs me on who to meet inside I felt like I really was in some sort of espionage movie. I didn't listen to him.  Of course we choose the wonderful seating alongside the fabulous window of 10th & W. The sun was beaming in illuminating the masterfully done table-scape. Quickly the barmaid said "ohh that is Reserved."  I thought damn, this place has changed. I remember you could sit anywhere and just eat wings be merry be a Viking. She pointed like an evil witch with a bent finger, to the really dark picnic table like area. The tables seating was like summer camp . It was accompanied with the ever so fabulous butcher style table cloths. My friend turned to me, remembers this is her first time here for the wing deal and said, "Wow so they treat the wings people different than everyone else?"  I kept explaining to her no, no, no...I guess they ran into some sort of problem. Actually why I am I making excuses. It is kind of messed up if you ask me. Kudos to the waiter he had personality, but kept explaining to me that there is a two drink minimum. My friend still confused asks for water. Threw us completely off because we were not sure If wanted to get a pitcher or not. Then my next thought was would we have to get 4 pitchers of yeungling. Whatever, it's getting to complicated just give me a yeungling and water we will figure it out later. One thing for sure the wings are great deal and tasty, yummy all the above.  Teriyaki very crispy and sweet tang to it, the hot was not crispy but not enough spice in my opinion could use a bit of crispiness. And the barbecue I just stayed away from. In the end we spent $18.00 on drinks and $10.00 to get in not a bad deal.

I find 10th and willow to be really hit or miss. I used to live really close to here in Hoboken so it was definitely convenient. I like the burgers... those are good! Once I got some sort of steak sandwich and I think I got an upset stomach from it so I wouldn't recommend that! One of their signature things is that they have flavored butters served with the bread that are different every day. It is a nice touch but nothing really too fancy or difficult. It's ridiculously easy to make a flavored butter and they definitely do not make the butter in house, they just throw some herbs and store bought butter in a hobart mixer for 2min and whoaaaaaaa flavored butter! They have nice specials during the week... all you can eat wings, half price appetizers, martini specials etc etc. The staff can be really nice or really terrible. I have definitely had some great service, but I have also had some awful service served with a sneer. I think some of the ladies employed here have a little bit of a "I think I'm really hot (but I'm actually not)" complex. It gets really crowded of Fri/Sat nights and I have definitely had some fun times dancing. They move the tables from the front bar area which really opens it up. They also have a coat check in the winter which is great.

Wowzers.. this place was hoppin' for a Tuesday night.  And full of all the kinds of people I would expect to be in a Hoboken establishment off the beaten path (of the PATH) - yuppies galore!  Anyway, I went straight back to the dining area and ordered some food.  I was a little on the intoxicated side when I ate, so my review may be a little skewed, though I didn't find anything wrong with the food at all.  I actually loved the warm bread on the table and the flavored butter.  I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap which hot the spot.  I was pleased with my food consumption for the evening.In terms of the bar area.. you probably wouldn't catch me hanging there.. not my scene.

One thing only to note about this place/makes it worth coming to - Best wings in Hoboken.  Yum.  They're kinda crazy because there's just so much meat on them (don't try and share as app with 2 people...you won't be eating entrees after), but I love 'em.  Only ever had to Terriyaki & Buffalo.  Terriyaki is OK; Buffalo has me coming back.They had $2 Coors Light all night last Saturday too, so that was pretty awesome as well for a deal.

Nothing more annoying then going to meet a friend or my fiance for dinner and being greeted by a rude " bouncer' asking to check your id. Happens whether it is 12pm on a Sunday or 5pm on a Wednesday. Puts off such a cheap and cheesy vibe as soon as you enter. Food is good but staff and atmosphere could use some work.
Been here couple of times. Nice bar with good music. Have heard a lot about its food from my friends but haven't tried food yet. Drinks are reasonably priced. Will go back here again.

10th & Willow is much like a bipolar girlfriend. Sometimes she treats you right, comforts your hunger, and quenches your thirst after a long work week. Other times she ignores your existence, chooses her more well-to-do friends over you, and rolls her eyes when you walk through the door.Given that I live right around the corner, I've seen both personalities. Let's start positive. My parents love coming here for dinner. Their burgers really are something to rave about, especially when ordered with their oversized English muffins. Their beer specials during dining hours are noteworthy as well - can't beat a Sierra Nevada draft for $2.50! The owner approached my parents at the end of our meal, hoped they liked their order, which they had, and offered them drinks at the bar on the house. Unfortunately, they were headed home and respectfully declined, but had very nice things to say about the offer on the ride back.When night rolls in, so do 10th & Willow's clientele. One example of this should give you a good picture of what to expect past 10:00p. I've seen two young women, maybe mid-20s, dressed to the nines, sit at the bar, order nothing at all, and spend twenty minutes looking over their shoulders with not a word exchanged between them. After their allotted time expired, that was their signal to move on to the next meat market seeing as no one gave them the time of day and bought either of them a drink. If this is how these women wanted to spend their night, wasted effort (or lack there of) that promises to never live up to their expectations, so be it. To the bar's defense, this isn't entirely under their control. They are a business like any other establishment and everyone is welcome. It's just a shame that those that choose to fill this particular establishment are often pretentious and, hate to break the news, better than you.I've read nightmares of how the staff has treated patrons, though I've never experienced it. I've gotten nothing but great service and nice gestures from the owner, the bartenders, and the bouncers alike. The drinks can be a bit costly, but nothing to complain about in Hoboken, and their entrees are a little overpriced.The beautiful wood decor should not go overlooked. 10th & Willow looks damn sexy and really puts on a great first impression - much like your bipolar girlfriend on the night you two kids met. By last call, the stiff crowd loosens up a bit. Do yourself a favor and save this bar for a nightcap.

I've lived in Hoboken for a year now, and wanted to try somewhere new for Sat brunch. Upon entering my husband and I were barely greeted before the hostess asked for our ID's. I was certainly taken aback since I had come there, first and foremost, to EAT! My husband presented his ID, but I told the hostess I did not have mine on me - as I left my handbag at home. She shifted focus and seated the couple in front of us with a baby. After returning she asked for my ID again, which I again explained I did not have on me. I told her I wasn't going to drink. She said "it doesn't matter, this is a BAR, and I can't let you in without an ID".  Let me put this into perspective for you - my husband and I are both in our early 40's, and do not look under 21!  Also, if this is a BAR like she said, then why didn't she card the baby that was with the couple...why is she letting a baby into a bar?!  Also if you are a BAR, why do you have a full FOOD menu?! Let's be honest...you can call EVERY food establishment a BAR in Hoboken because of its young demographic. However, this was not 11pm on a Friday night...this was Noon on a Saturday afternoon!  My suggestion: they need to change their policy and have the servers card people at the tables during dining hours. By the looks upon entering the place, it was empty - they looked like they were hurting for brunch business...and it was later clear to me that this place has most likely been busted in the past for serving minors! I will NOT be back!!!!

Not a bad location, although hard to find parking around, and certainly a bit chillier due to the open space than expected. Seated on higher bar chairs around the tables on the edge of the space for brunch, there's a nice selection for brunch.Unfortunately, the food took a while to come out, and was no longer hot by the time it reached my table other than the inside of my eggs for the eggs benedict, and the hollandaise sauce was incredibly salty, too. Ham was okay, but it tasted and felt like round spam, as opposed to real ham...Probably a better bar than restaurant in the winter, I susepct.

The food is decent, but the staff is sub par. Rude/slow waiters, and I've seen that the bouncers think they are policeman. I've seen them be very rough on patrons that aren't deserving of it. Power trip to the max. Overpriced and meh food.The only redeeming quality is their buffalo shrimp app. YUM!

I wish there was a negative star rating because this was the WORST service I have ever experience in my life.My friend and I arrived at 9:15 (because we both work late hours, like real adults) and were informed immediately we needed to leave the outside area by 11PM. We said, "fine." Sat down, 10 minutes later - no service in sight, were told again "You need to leave at 11PM."; again we said "We got it, you told us already, please get us a waitress so we can order and leave." By 10:30 we ordered our 4th cocktail( that the waitress offered...) which took until 10:49 to arrive, paid our $70 bill and were informed at 10:55 we needed to leave, as we were not even finished with our drinks. After telling the manager, "We know - we need to leave at 11PM, we have 5 minutes and we will be done." He replied, "No, you need to leave now, we have to clear the table." So needless to say, we revised our bill to take the tip away - because I'll be damned if I am going to tip for this...and left without being able to finish our drinks. WHO ASKS PAYING CUSTOMERS TO LEAVE WHEN THEY HAVENT FINISHED YET...?!?!I dont care if Hoboken is completely out of food and this was the only establishment open, I would never eat here again. The manager was absolute jersey trash and should be fired immediately for complete disrespect. Oh and PS - He was annoyed I brought my 10 pnd dog that sat under the table the entire meal. Get over yourself, this place is not that cool.

10th and Willow is a fantastic place for different types of nights. I have held events there, taken my parents for dinner there, and spent a lot of time at the bar, or eating brunch or dinner with friends there. Many people don't know about the delicious menu that 10th and Willow offers. Some don't think of it as a restaurant b/c it didn't always have such a varietal menu. Before I dragged my husband there, who is now a fan, he always thought it was just a club. The drinks are fantastic and their menu offers so many different options. They have terrific specials throughout the week as well. Nice ambiance since they redid the place a few years ago. Check out free wing night on Mondays and try their chicken cheesesteak!

I have heard terrific things about 10th & Willow, especially in regards to their food.  Though the beer and wings are the main draw here, the rustic pub also serves some fancier entrees as well.My lowly review is based on a quick trip to the bar on a Saturday evening.  My friend and I luckily avoided a line by going early, however, once we entered the bar, we could not move.  The place was packed, but not in a good way...We managed to snag two seats at the bar, but were constantly being pushed from behind by those submitting drink orders.  Also, the music was way too loud.  This might be a great place to watch a game or enjoy some bar snacks, but it is definitely not conducive to a chill night out.

Went for a beer after work and they required 2 forms of ID with birth dates. The place was loud and indecent at 7 PM (not that I have a problem with that) and I was meeting a couple of older friends who were already there. Would not accept a drivers license, credit card, and school ID.  They lost my business forever

This place is definitely quality over quantity. Wednesday night has half priced menu, got the skirt steak over meshed, it was delicious, but only five slices of steak cooked to perfection. buffalo shrimp appetizer was awesome, strongly recommended. Wife had the angel hair with mussel it was flavorful and enjoyed it as well. Normally If your not ordering sandwiches or burgers the entrees here are pricey, not what you expect from a bar restaurant. But it's worth it, the food and services here are top notch.

Decent wings (meaty and medium spice), decent burger (unwieldy) and fries and decent beer selection for a reasonable price. Went on a Sunday and it was packed with a rather interesting mix of clientele from hipster to fashion forward.

I've lived in Hoboken for over 5 years and had been coming to 10th and Willow long before that. I have always been satisfied with the okay service and sub-par quality until yesterday at brunch. My husband asked the server if it would be possible to order the french onion soup, as it was not on the brunch menu. We ordered the soup and an omelet with two ingredients. It took over 30 minutes. Then, when we finally get the check at the end of the meal, the soup is $12!!!! We couldn't believe our eyes and even asked the sever if there was a mistake. Nope. Just another Hoboken dive thinking they're some swanky NYC restaurant.

Love this place!!!  10th & Willow is definitely my favorite night spot on the weekends (best DJ in my opinion), but I also love their food!  Great happy hour specials.  Went on a Friday evening recently for dinner and had a veggie burger.  I wasn't sure how this would come out, because lots of restaurants don't do a good veggie burger, but this burger was awesome (probably had a lot to do with the cheese, onions, ketchup and mustard).  We also got the thai calamari which was soo yummy.  Buffalo calamari is also delish here.Can't wait to go back for another veggie burger!
The Atmosphere is top shelf!  The food was fantastic!!   The wings are the best in North Jersey. The burger my friend has was also very good.   I have had their pork chops and they are the bomb!

I really like this place.  Good vibe, friendly staff, and specials every day.  (Wednesday I believe is half-off the food menu, and Friday I know is a special on margaritas).  Also, for Monday Night Football they have free wings all night!

I've been here a total of three times - 2 were for dinner with my girlfriend and 1 was a late night stop for drinks to cap the night.The atmosphere is very much like a bar trying to double as a restaurant with random tables scattered about, which I usually don't mind except for the fact that dinner is extremely pricey and you would expect less of a sports bar atmosphere for dinner.  They do have a dining room in the back, which is totally fine, but you still hear all of the noise coming from their bar area.  That being said, the food has never disappointed.  Both times I had dinner with my girlfriend the food was delicious.  We usually go halfsies because we're foodies and can never just have 1 thing on the menu.  I've had the crab cakes, the filet mignon, the baby back ribs, and a stuffed NY strip steak special - all of which were well above what I had expected.  I've also had two salads that were specials at the time and both were excellent.  The food is along the quality I would expect at a classier restaurant and it is quite surprising to be served these high quality dishes at what seems like (and smells like) a frat bar.The place is actually pretty good for drinks too - they get a pretty good crowd going late at night.  I guess that would explain the beer soaked wooden floors which give off the aroma of a frat house attic.Overall 3 stars - great food (better than what the atmosphere would suggest, but certainly on par with what the price would suggest) but the noise and the smell can get to you if you're planning on having a nice quiet dinner.  I'd give it 4 stars if I were just going to watch a game and have some wings and beer.

Quite possibly the worst brunch I have ever experienced. Ever. Not worth the money.The bloody marys are excellent-but beware expensive $10. And they WILL add up, especially when you are forced to wait an hour (or more) for your food. The Mimosas were also about $9. Not worth it. Weak and not made with fresh OJ. Our meals took an hour and when they finally arrived the food was cold (but the plates were scorching hot). We were a party of 6 so I don't mind waiting, but it was clear our server had screwed up the order. My omelet was particularly disappointing. Overcooked with almost no fillings and the toast was cold. Our server conveniently disappeared around this time - most likely aware of our disappointment. When she finally decided to appear - I sent my meal back. I am a very polite person and never do this, but it was that bad.

Came here for brunch this past Sunday to cap off a fun girl's night with some college friends. My friend who lives in hoboken is right down the street, so this was super convenient, as most Sunday mornings after a night out the less planning the better. There was no wait at noon on Sunday, so that was nice. The ambiance is very nice- exposed brick, high top tables, a big bar. There are several flat screen tvs. The only thing I didn't like was the dim lighting- there weren't any interior lights on, and the sun only came in from the top of the They serve brunch every day; my two friends got the willow breakfast which consisted of eggs, breakfast meat of your choice, toast, fruit, home fries, and french toast. I decided to get the huevos rancheros; their take included two poached eggs on top of a black bean purree and crisp corn tortilla, salsa fresca, and guacamole. This was also served with a side of home fries. The food was good- my meal was nicely portioned, though I think $12.00 is a bit much to charge for what I got, but they gave me a huge scoop of guacamole. My friend's french toast was the size of regular bread (nothing thick and hearty which I automatically think of when I hear french toast), but it was coated with lots of cinnamon and sugar and it had a nice crisp to it. Their breakfasts were pretty big, but I don't know if it was $16.00 Our server was friendly and came around with coffee and water frequently. Our total bill came to a little under 60.00, which was kind of pricey (split 20.00 before tip) but I feel like that's hoboken for you.

10th and Willow is an enigma. I heard rumors of these amazing wing deals and decided to check it out with a friend when other dinner plans fell through. Sure enough, on Mondays $5 gets you unlimited wings (teriyaki, bbq, and hot), but there's also a 2 drink minimum. Unfortunately, I am not crazy about wings, but my compadre really enjoyed 'em. Instead, I opted for the skirt steak salad, which was awesome! The set up of this place was just a little bit curious. I was expecting sports bar with that kind of wing special, but there was a fair amount of romantic ambiance in there. Candle lit tables at 7pm made us question the whole thing since we weren't sure what we were in for. The establishment is much larger than it appears from the outside, too. The further you go back (3 rooms in total) the more romantic it gets. When we arrived there were a fair number of seating options when we walked in, but they soon went away. By the time we left, the place was packed to the gills! Men were standing around shoulder to shoulder sucking every ounce of meat off their precious wings. How they dealt with the 2 drink minimum without a place to set their beverages, I have no idea. Service was good. Ambiance was unexpected, but good. I'll be back.

Very solid, but not memorable local spot.Admittedly, I am not typically a fan of businesses that transform on fri/sat nights into jersey shore/fist pumping type places.  It's also somewhat suprising given its location in hoboken.That being said, I have had really good experiences here watching sunday football.  It's a great local place in a nice quiet area.  Big fan of the decor inside, somewhat dim, lots of dark woods.  The food is solid 3-star fare, albeit expensive. I came here on Sunday for Mother's day and I must give credit to the service, specifically Elizabeth.  She was very friendly and did alot to accomodate my party pretty last minute.I did not like how the tables were extremely wobbly, but they seemed to have an endless supply of wedges to remedy the situation.The major downside was how long it took to get the food.  Granted, we were just enjoying time with family, but we put in an order for my cute lil two year old niece as soon as we got there (she is unbelievably adorable, but does not particularly care for waiting on her food when she is hungry), and it took an extremely long time.  Likewise for the rest of us.Huge + for the muffins and flavored butters.  Muffins tasted great, served fresh, soft and warm.I think everyone really liked their food without it being spectacular.  My niece's kids menu chicken fingers were good, but no wow factor.  I ordered the breakfast sliders which is an amazing idea, but to sound like one of those obnoxious cooking/judging shows, the execution was a little lacking.  Maybe it was lukewarm when it arrived, but it kind of looked like a great idea and I could have done it in my apartment.  Even so, it was a solid meal.Drinks - + for being very strong.  - for being expensive.  No real drink deals (1 reublik has $2 mimosas, or my favorite Essex House's seemingly endless supply of alcohol with amazing food).So the brunch is good, but could be a little expensive.  I would return, and wouldnt dissuade anyone from eating here, but would probably prefer to explore other places in the truly amazing city of Hoboken first.

Decent happy hour specials and good bar food specials during the week. It turns into woo-girl central on the weekends, with white people trying to dance to boring music. On the plus side, I don't think it's been crowded since 2009.

This is a reliable option in Hoboken.  We've experienced it for dinner, brunch, late night dancing, and Sunday football.  I don't ever remember having complaints, but it also doesn't ever stick out as being a place I MUST go.  One thing to note: the homemade butters with bread before dinner are a different flavor each time, and the maple walnut one is excellent.

I've always had a great time at 10th & Willow - food is always good! Wraps, chicken, salad, sliders, wings - it's all good. Last night was an exception - for the service, not the food. Food was fine, but we had the most obnoxious waitress, who forgot the wine order and bread in the beginning and then got upset with us when we asked for something else. She needs a different job.

The food really isn't that great. It's more like cheap bar food. It gets very loud and the owner is pretty rude.I only know all of this because last time I ate there I got food poisoning and was blowing chunks for 3 days.

The $5 all you can eat wings Monday deal is hands down the best deal in Hoboken. It's not even just because of the price, those wings are fantastic, regardless of the price. I've had a few of the sandwiches here and they always hit the spot but the rest of the menu is completely unexpected. Even though I like this place, if I want to eat chilean sea bass or pork chops, I won't be ordering it at a bar.This place also makes for a great bar when it doesn't get packed which definitely happens from time to time. At that point its just about impossible to get a drink since the bar is really long and there's max 2 bartenders staffing it.

This is my favorite bar in Hoboken.  I may be a little biased because it is the first place I went to after moving into my apartment and it's on my block but the place is awesome.  I was welcomed as a neighbor since the first day I stepped in.  I enjoy the selection of food they offer from brunch through dinner, it's all pretty much really good stuff. The atmosphere is pretty cool.  There is a nice bar with some high top tables, room to maneuver and 6 big flat screens to catch the games and big windows to people watch.  There is always decent music playing.  Through the first bar there is a second smaller bar and dining room then even another dining room back even further.  When the weather is nice there are a dozen or so tables outside as well. A nice touch for when the weather is cold they have hot chocolate outside so when you leave to walk home at the end of the night.They have a decent selection of rotating beers on tap.  If you know what to ask for they usually have some decent bottled beers as well if you know what to ask for. The wines are nothing to write home about, but a decent selection for (Mark West Pinot, Cloudy Bay Sav Blanc) if that's what you are looking for.  Fully stocked bar and well made drinks are always to be had as well. Willow has a great happy hour 4-7 every day, half priced domestic beers and martini's which means $2.50 pints and $5 martinis.The food is usually really good.  If you go for brunch make sure you ask for the muffins and butter of the day.  The mini muffins are usually warm and the kitchen is usually whipping up some sort of tasty flavored butter like cinnamon sugar to slather on the muffins. The lunch/dinner menu is really yummy too.  My favorite appetizers include the spinach/artichoke dip, the wings and one of my favorites is the buffalo calamari.  The sweet/spicy buffalo sauce covered with blue cheese is awesome.  The salads really good, the beet and cobb salads are standouts. I tend to not order the main entrees but the chicken cheese steak sandwich is good and the burgers are all pretty good.  But my favorite sandwich by far is chicken cutlet which features prosciutto, mozzarella and broccoli rabe served with marinara sauce for dipping.  No matter what sandwich you order, I would ask for the garlic mashed potatoes which are awesome.The weekly specials are really good.  Monday from 11am-11pm they offer all you can eat wings for $5.  There are buffalo and BBQ wings which are good but the best by far are the teriyaki!  Pair that up with a few HH beers and I call that a good night.   1/2 price select apps on Tuesday and  1/2 price select entrees on Wednesdays (the farfalle pasta is really good).  Thursday nights are  1/2 price beers and Martini's till midnight can make Friday's rough.All in all these are just a few reasons why I love 10th and Willow.

Have come here with friends a few times for drinks (usually a pregaming spot before moving on to more fun places.)  The one time I actually ate here, I had the crab cakes.  Not a fan, and soooo overpriced.  They need to get their quality up and their prices in check.  The service is pretty good, though.  Overall, not a fan of this place.

This place is around the corner from my boyfriend's apartment, so this is one of our go-to places when we're lazy and want to go out. The atmosphere is very nice - since we were having dinner, we were seated all the way in the back room, away from the noise and commotion of the bar. There was plenty of outdoor seating as well. I enjoy that they leave a pitcher of water on your table so you're not constantly waiting for refills. Since we were the only customers in the back dining room, the service was a little slower, but the waitress still did a good job.They serve bread and flavored butter - they are always changing the flavors and it is always delicious. Definitely something I look forward to coming here.The food is great, as well. Check their weekly specials: Tuesdays are 1/2 price apps, and Wednesdays are 1/2 price entrees. I had a delicious skirt steak and my boyfriend got a burger. The portions were the perfect amount, not overly enormous, and the flavors were all delicious. The prices were reasonable for the quality of the food and atmosphere of the restaurant.Overall, great place. I still have other restaurants I prefer in Hoboken which is why I'm only giving 4/5 stars, but it's definitely worth trying and I will be coming back here for sure.

Went here for a friend of mines birthday and had a fantastic time. The package included an open bar for $40 which you were given a wristband as soon as you walked in the door. The front room is quite small and crowded but the manager quickly moved us to a more spacious and comfortable back area with its own bar.

4 stars with some occasions bordering on 5. I've eaten probably well over a hundred times over the years and definitely consider it a good to spot. First off, the staff is always very friendly and attentive. The owner (or who I assume if the owner) is always there and runs a pretty tight ship.The layout is a large bar with a few tv's in the front and a more quite restaurant in the rear. They have it separated well enough that when your in the restaurant portion you really feel like your in a restaurant, not just a bar with tables.They probably run some of the best specials in Hoboken. All you can eat wings on Mondays, half price entrees on Wednesday's and martini specials on Thursdays.The crowd, even on the weekends, is always a little better dressed and more social then what downtown Hoboken attracts.Alas, the one downfall.. The menu tries to be more upscale bar fare. Some of the things work, some don't. I've never eaten a meal there that caused me to complain, I just feel like the kitchen can be inconsistent and the food doesn't always live up to what should be expected, especially given the fact some entrees are pretty pricey.All in all, its a great, reliable spot. One of the few good options you have if you live in midtown.
Delicious food, friendly staff, great drink specials and promotional nights. Having just moved to the neighborhood, I think I've found my new favorite local spot!

Poor food. Very over priced. The chef who made this place great-about 3 years ago, is long gone. So are all the cool waiters & bartenders. The owner is really moody & unfriendly. He only has a few locals he is friendly with. Go to the Turtle Club around the corner, they have good pub fare, the owners know how to treat their customers, and the environment and music are much better. There are much better options in Hoboken.

I've eaten here several times since I live around the corner and have yet to be impressed. I don't know why I keep giving it a chance when I'm continually disappointed. The food is way over priced based on the quality. In fact I'm pretty sure they microwaved the burger I order the other night. The only time I would recommend going here is for Monday night football, Wing Night. Other than that, don't bother.
Tonight's bill over $300 for mediocre bar food! Never going again ! Over priced mediocre restaurant In Hoboken .

I am definitely a regular at 10th and willow. The food and service is consistent. Also it is a nice mix of a bar/restaurant. As the ultimate foodie, I always feel the need to switch up my food items however I get the same dish every time I come here. (I do throw in random app every now and then)The cornbread encrusted BBQ guava chicken with chipotle and cheddar mashed potatoes is the way to go. Different yet basic and always delicious. If you never ordered this, I highly recommend you check it out next time you are in the area. Love the flavored butter that comes with the bread basket. Really keeps me on my toes!And no meal is complete without dessert. They have homemade desserts that vary every day. All in all it is a great bar scene with everything from basic bar food to upscale entrees. Definitely a bit pricey but great dining experience.

Been to 10th and Willow more times than I can count. I have yet to be disappointed as for as the food ( minus the crappy fries).  Waiters and waitresses were very proficient. ***Burgers & Salads are ABSOLUTELY GREAT ***This place is a Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde type of place. I will agree with  reviewer Emily B, this place seems like it is trying to appeal to EVERY one. It's upscale, casual, sports bar, lounge, restaurant, or wanna be nightclub pending on the weekend night (I refuse to go on Saturday nights).  Drinks are pricey, except for the daily specials. It used to get insanely crowded when it was the only establishment in Uptown Hoboken West that's not on or near Washington St. However, the Turtle Social Club up the block on 9th and Park has now given this place competition as far as the bar scene goes. Time to lower those drink prices 10th.
Looks nice during day and food is OK, but they turn it into an awful awful club at night.  Not really a big fan of it.

Fantastic burgers and sandwiches. Favorites are Buffalo Calamari and the Mexicali Burger.  Other dishes are a bit pricey considering it's more of a bar atmosphere. Great service and great happy hour specials. PS.  They deliver too.

I've never been to the wing night on Mondays, and I heard that's pretty cool, so I'm not going to give this place 1 star.  I have been here on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, however, and it's not pretty.  It's incredibly packed, the line to the bathroom is long, and the music is a nightmare-ish mix of crappy 80's songs, top 40 songs for uncoordinated white guys to dance to, and Bon Jovi.  I have to admit that watching guys strike out with girls they've been feeling up for 20 minutes is hilarious, so ladies, be prepared to hear some of the worst game of your lives.  That being said, getting smushed at the bar and having to yell over the third playing of "Don't Stop Believing" doesn't entice me to go back.

I'm reviewing this strictly on brunch, which was terrible.  The restaurant smelled like Friday night's beer.  The hostess never attempted to smile.The food was disappointing.  I had the cinnamon raisin french toast.  For 10 dollars, you get 2 dollar worth of toast.  The slices are very thin and far from filling.  My girlfriend had the breakfast skillet.  It was dry and tasteless.  Denny's has better breakfast skillets, and that's no joke.Both items had a side of fruit...fruit from CVS.Our total was $65 for a two sub-par meals and two lackluster drinks a piece.  Stay away from this place for brunch.

stopped by for dinner last week and it's so cute! the outdoor seating is wonderful and ideal because indoor seating can be a bit too close for comfort. the food was great, drinks were delicious and service was fair - reasonably priced too. I'll def be going back :)
10th and willow, you have a good atmosphere, pretty solid menu but.....WHERE IS MY FOOD. Brunch means you haven't breakfast or lunch and waiting for 35+ minutes becomes dangerous

Let me start by saying i HATE this place. I live in the neighborhood so checked it out a few times: nothing to write home about. I ordered the shrimp and pasta dish- $29 for 5 of the smallest shrimp I've ever eaten AND THEY WEREN'T EVEN CLEANED. I'd rather go up the street to Anthony David's where I can actually get a nice set of prawns that are de-vained, cleaned properly, and are the size of my head. When I spoke to the waiter at 10th & willow about this ridiculously priced dish that was extremely small- he totally agreed with me. the bill came to $80 something for 2 entrees and 2 beers. which if you ask me is RIDICULOUS for a restaurant; that isn't Michelin rated, that doesn't have a celebrity or even outstanding chef. I foolishly gave it another chance. one night i ordered a salad and some wings for takeout. as I'm eating it I find a hair in it. OK, i work in the restaurant biz- i know these things happen. fine. i pick it out and move on, trying to forget about it. midway though my salad I start choking on a hair that was literally half way down my throat. I am not kidding when i say my friend had to pat me on the back several times so as not to swallow it. I somehow managed to pull it out to find a long black hair. Being a blond i knew it wasn't mine and was so disgusted at this point I put everything in the trash. Called the next day to speak to a manager and was finally called back the next day by the owner. WHO IS A COMPLETE A$$HOLE. he hurried me off the phone, hardly apologized and was like if you want another salad call me. We were on the phone for about 40 seconds and i get that there isn't much to say, but this d bag was not sorry and didn't really care about the hair in the salad situation. I will never ever EVER eat here again. I'd rather starve than go back to this loser's restaurant.

I went here for dinner last night with some friends and it was a pretty enjoyable evening. Although I can't quite figure out what kind of place it wants to be, it seems to be balancing its multiple personalities quite nicely. When we first walked in I thought my friend must have taken us to a sports bar because the front room was noisy and filled with people watching football playoffs. (Love football but my team didn't make the playoffs and I just wasn't in the mood.) We were lead to a table in the back, but first walked into another room where there were no tables and just people standing up at the bar. It was bumping dance music and a group of girls had hung a "Happy Birthday Bitch" sign on the wall. Classy. But we finally reached the back of the restaurant which was perfectly civilized and full of people quietly having dinner. The place was pretty busy and our waiter did a pretty good job managing all the tables he had which was the entire back room. My friend and I shared the Skirt Steak Salad and the Mexicali Burger. The salad was tasty but nothing amazing. I found the steak to be a little chewier than I prefer and I realize this has something to do with the cut of meat but also know that skirt steak prepared well doesn't require quite as much masticating. The Mexicali burger was delightful--nice and big and cooked perfectly. It had ample, fresh avocado (not slightly browning, mushy, or stingy like most places) and the roll it was on was excellent. The only lackluster part of the burger was the fries--they were completely uninspired, kind of cold, and no better than something you could get at at Denny's.
I would love to come here often! Living in Hoboken, I used to eat here every other day. I love love love the flavored butters!

Tried their wings tonight via delivery - delivery was quick, wings were ok. Is this my go-to for buffalo wings in Hoboken (which they clarified to be called "hot wings" and not buffalo wings)? Undetermined.

Place is a little dark.  As my friend Liz would say.. great first day atmosphere if he is questionable.  I like how they had three different rooms.  First one has a bar, high top tables and tvs for games.  The other two are nicer tables very railroad style.I was told that this place is known for its different type of butters that come in your bread basket.They have tons of diffferent type of sandwichs and burgers which were yummy.  Beware it is a ton of food.

I have to agree with almost every review on here; the food is very good and the drinks are fairly priced with an extended martini list. The staff itself is great and pleasant, BUT the owner is an obnoxious egomaniac who does walk throughs in a Batman shirt and skinny jeans. He is rude to his staff in front of patrons and pretty much hits on anything that moves. That being said, It's still a place to try because of the menu and the bar staff.  Note to those who go there, if you do happen to meet the owner, never give any critiques, positive or negative. If you do you'll probably be asked to leave...Specials:Monday night - Free wings and $2 Miller and Coors Lite Tues - Half Price AppsThurs - Half price Martini's and a $10 open bar from 10-11pm
Good for happy hour during the week - they have different specials each day of the week - decent food - and convenient location to people living in hobo

A-OK. I'd give it 5 stars for Wing Night on Mondays (but shhh! don't tell anyone about it!!) and 2 stars for the rest of the nights. It's an average bar.  It's super-crowded on the weekends, which is usually fine with me... but for some reason, I've never really met the nicest people there. Maybe I'm there on the wrong nights - who knows.  Wing Night, however, is amazing. Minimum of 2 drinks per person and there is a complimentary.... did you hear me? I said complimentary... full wing buffet.   You have 3 options - BBQ, Teriyaki or Hot wings.  I am a huge fan of the teriyaki.  You also have choices of carrots and celery and blue cheese.    They ran out of wings? Don't worry hundreds more are on their way.   Great marketing strategy and it seems to be working for them!   I'll most likely go back on the weekends, but it's not my favorite going-out bar.   Definitely one of my favorite Monday night spots.

Had lunch with family today. Good food. Terribly slow service. Too pricey for portion size. Owner seemed distressed. Dropped the F bomb within earshot of diners. Nice!!. One waiter covering all the tables, it seemed. Anyway come back for dimmer and drinks. Has to be better and a whole lot less screaming kids around. Lots of tvs.

I haven't been to 10th & Willow for a long time and I had actually never eaten there until this past weekend. The place overall is small but a good time. My friends and I went or our girlfriends birthday dinner we were a group of 10 which is fairly large but they were able to accommodate us all comfortably.  We're a pretty rowdy bunch and got the attention of GM who took great care of us with speedy service and complimentary shots... the way to all of our hearts. Dinner was surprisingly good. I really didn't know what to expect but for some reason didn't have high hopes but I was pleasantly surprised. A few dishes at the table were pizza pies, crab cakes, sesame encrusted tuna I had the sea bass which I subbed with garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was excellent. They sent out a nice dessert for our friends birthday and all in all made it a great girls night out. I'd absolutely go back for dinner as far as the night scene is concerned jury's still out.

Just a walk from my cousin's apartment.  We sat outside and ordered the white sangria, which was so refreshing!  Loved how much fruit there was.  The waiter brought us small fresh corn muffins with their own infused apple pie butter. Mmmmm good! I have an obsession with artichoke & spinach dips and love trying them at all the restaurants I go to. This one was really fresh with whole pieces of artichokes & spinach!  It was served with flat bread.  Be careful with your teeth when you eat the flat bread, its really hard but good!  Next I ordered the Chicken BLT with the herb paste.  It was fresh and had a tangy flavor.  My cousin ordered the Chicken cheesesteak with the cherry peppers.  Her eyes lit up when she got her plate.  She said it was cheesy, hot, and yummy.We finished our pitcher of sangria and left with a smile.  We might even go back later on tonight for dancing and drinks!

WORST DINING EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!! First of all, I am not one to take the time to give reviews such as this... I mean, who has the time? However, I was so offended by my recent visit to this 'restaurant' that I can't help now but to vent.I recenetly moved from NYC to Hoboken and have been hard pressed to find many options for young professionals who are not still in to the college partying scene that is so prevalent there; especially downtown. So my boyfriend and I took to exploring the uptown bars/restaurants to find something more our style. When passing by on the street, this place looked great! It had a beautiful back dining room with several tables by the windows. We were excited to find something with an older crowd and stepped in for dinner after work one evening to grab a bit to eat and a few drinks.Me: "Hi, its going to be just 2 for dinner."Hostess: "For dinner, or would you like to go to the bar?"Me: "No, just a table for dinner. Can we sit at one of those high-tops?"Hostess: "Sure." (Turns around to grab our menus...)                  "Actually, can I see your ID's please?"Me: "Huh?"Hostess: "Your ID's...."Me: (still baffled) "Why are you asking to see our ID's?" Hostess: "We ask everyone for thier ID's."Me: "But we're here for a table to have dinner?" (Both my boyfriend and I are 25 by the way...)Hostess: (With a snide smile on her face) "Well we need to check your ID here so that if you have a drink at your table, your server will already know."Me: "I mean, which is it...a restaurant or a bar first? We came here to sit down for dinner?"I could keep going, but you get the picture... I was so put off by this first experience that it ruined my meal and I will never give them my business again. Would they really reject a customer for dinner if they were 20?? I asked our waiter if this was common practice and he replied that yes, she asks everyone who comes in the door (...even for dinner???). I have never seen such a thing. Not only were her mannerisms towards us offensive, but NO she did NOT check anyone else's ID's who came in for dinner OR the BAR after us (families and other couples). I still cannot believe that this place treated 2 potential returning customers this way!

I have been to 10th and Willow a few times for dinner. I think Ihave had the hummus, a salad a burgers. Everything was pretty good. They also have really cheap martinins on Thursday nights for ladies. Oh and there is a really hot bartender!I went two weeks ago on a Saturday night which I was not looking forward to. I heard some scary things from my friends about how is was liek a club and filled with stereotypical Jersey guidos. Not the case at all! The place was a little on the young side (I am 28), but I thought it was a good bar crowd. Not sure about the cost of drinks (it was one of those nights where things got cloudy). Only warning I will give is there were tons of guys. I am not complaining, but just thought I would warn the boys :)
I'm a fan of 10th & Willow, mainly for their happy hour.  I work in the neighborhood and you can't beat 1/2 price drinks that start at 4:00.  I will be here quite often...good food menu too.

5 star on the wings, absolutely the best in town. Place is lively and energetic on Mondays. I guess that's the price you pay when it's an all you can eat wings for $5. Drinks are also respectful, not watered down. Def recommended.

I have to break this review up into two parts, one is a review of the bar at night, the other is a review of the brunch. Let us begin.....The bar is right around the corner from where I live, so moving in I thought I would be here a lot. Unfortunately for me this bar is full of pretentious people so I have not been here too much. Drinks are priced accordingly but the atmosphere is very stiff. I would advise coming to this bar drunk already if you want to have a good time.The brunch is a bit expensive as average meals are over $14. But, I will say they give you enough food to be full until dinner. There is also a different butter offered every weekend. The time I went it was an apple toffee butter and it was delicious. I wish that brunch came with a complimentary alcoholic drink like most other brunches offered in the area.

This is my favorite restaurant in Hoboken for a number of reasons: ambience is fab, music is always great and I've never had a meal there I didn't LOVE. Most incredible appetizers: buffalo shrimp and the baked brie. Delicious entrees: cornbread encrusted chicken, pepper encrusted filet mignon, willow ave burger, crab cakes....I dream about everything on the menu. The wings are PHHHEENNOMENAL. They're huge, meaty, juicy monsters. Drool.
best wings in Hoboken. if you have an opportunity must stop by on a Monday for $5 all you can eat.also surprisingly one of the best places to go out at night. good crowd.

So far one of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken -- When I moved into the neighborhood, our landlord told us about 10th and Willow and said we needed to check it out.  She was not wrong.  The food is great, the servings are huge, and ambience (especially if you sit in the back dining room area) is really nice.  I haven't been here for the bar, but for dinner, it's spot on. My husband and I brought his whole family and his family friends here the day after Christmas.  We were catered to so well with the owner (manager?) coming up to us and asking us how everything was, and even offerring us free drinks.  Once he found out my husband and I lived nearby, he even offerred to hold an extra copy of our key at the bar in case we ever lock ourselves out!  haha.  So, all in all, a great place.  Definately try their burger with the onion rings on it -- the onion rings might be the best onion rings i ever had in my life -- too bad they don't serve them just as sides!

Went here for a few drinks on a Thursday night.  Nice open bar area with a little dining in the main room, and a small bar and more dining in back.  Cool place.  Good selection of beer and booze, interesting yet unpretentious young crowd.  The music was a little loud, but I think they were trying to initiate some dancing in the main room.  Nice Hoboken neighborhood bar.

Food was very good. The two people I was with got breakfast, I got a burger which was delicious and filling (good topping options too like avocado, sauteed onions, etc). Also got the nachos which had real chili, served nice and hot. Would have liked if our waiter was a little more attentive to us, but that's probably nit picking. And free-unlimited wings for Monday Night Football - WOW.
Great spot off the beaten path in Hoboken. My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's day; the food was delicious and the ambiance was romantic.

Went here on 4th of July right after the fireworks - was empty but soon filled up very quickly.  The owner introduced himself and we all enjoyed a shot on the house!  Atmosphere and drinks were great - love my flavored vodka! Want to def. come back to try their food

We had 10th and Willow cater a recent party and everything was great. The person that handled the catering order was very thorough and helpful. They suggested we get the food delivered right before the guest arrived so the sandwiches were hot and the wings were crispy.  We also ordered some salads which were awesome.  I highly recommend if you are considering having an event catered. I will absolutely use them again!

I don't get this place. The front room is baseball hat wearing idiots typical of NJ shore crowd ' Joeys, Bobbys, Tonys etc.  The back rooms however are very inviting.  The waitress however are inept. When you bring to their attention a problem with the food or service they look at you unapologetic and walk away.  HORRIBLY rude!! And, MOST important is I will never spend $13 for a regular plain hamburger.  Are they kidding? It's not free-range grass fed cows or Kobe.  The $4.99 Five Brother's Burger on Washing blows this place away.  Majority of their biz must come from the idiot B&T crowd on weekends.

Have come w my bf on a variety of occasions. If it's not summertime, we always prefer to sit int the back room. It's more romantic back there plus given the time of night the front room can get very noisy, ESP if there's a game on. 10th and willow can make a mean dirty martini and their crab cakes are some of the best I have ever choices I have always thought that their menu was a little too narrow. I'm only in Hoboken on weekends but I am told that 10th and willow has a great wing night and good martini specials on thurs.rGood classy neighborhood restaurant and a great choice for a local romantic dinner.
man..i dont know about yall but for $5 all you can eat wings on mondays. you cant beat THAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!and they give you blue cheese.
standard bar, with a slightly older and sexy crowd, it's definitely on the top of my list of places to hit up when i go out in Hoboken

Was here yesterday for the first time and I must say had a blast! Wings are off the hook! Sliders were off the hook! Of course I found that the bartender I was dealing with was not the best; however the rest of the staff was helpful and friendly. Thought that it was a great place to have the party I was attending.

An Inattentive and slow staff made me feel I received poor service. The quality and presentation of the Food was unacceptable and not well thought out.  Both the owner and his staff handled themselves in a manor that I considered rude and unprofessional. I will never go back there again.

This review is for the bar only - I have not had the food here.  I came here for the first time the other night and nothing really wowed me, but it definitely isn't a bad place, either.  The place wasn't incredibly packed (at least the night I was there) so you definitely had some room to operate.  This review is definitely a little more vague than my other reviews but there isn't much else to say.  It is just a pretty ordinary bar in Hoboken.

The food here is consistently good. They always infuse something in their butter (e.g. orange peel, strawberry, etc.) that comes with the bread basket, which is quite neat. They have really good wings. They have 3 flavors, and I like the teriyaki one best. During the summer, they have a tasty and refreshing lobster roll.

My wife and I had a great time sitting at the bar last night.  Tracy was the bartender and she was a real pleasure. Good personality and great drinks. The owner could not have been more welcoming. Bought us, and others, a round of drinks as well as gave us a tour of his restaurant. Friendly, local bar and patrons and we made reservations while there for dinner Wednesday night.  Go, it's fun and you won't be disappointed.  I gave it four stars only because we have yet to try the food. I will update this after our Wednesday dinner.

My husband and I have been going to 10th and Willow for about 2 years now.  It used to be a great neighborhood spot for us and we could always count on it for a tasty burger (esp. the sliders) and good service.  Lately it's been 'meeh' and for some reason our bill keeps getting higher and higher.  Tonight, I ordered a special mahi mahi taco dish which cost $28.00.  It was edible but nothing worth that much.  The app was okay too. In the end we spent around $95.00 with tip which was such a waste of money. So overpriced for not great food. Needless to say, we wont be coming back.

Don't let the white table cloths deter you from entering. This place would get 5 stars if it wasn't for the night-scene and the long wait for our food. I love small touches like the muffins before your meal. We all ordered burgers. Everyone cleaned their plate. They even make a good veggie burger. I'd definitely go back.
I only went in for a few drinks but I was impressed with what I saw. Our beer was reasonably priced and our food (we ordered an appetizer) hit the spot. I'll be going back.

Stopped in on the way home for a burger and app with my girl. A guy sitting on Walmart plastic chairs out front brought us inside, never said to enjoy ourselves or made it clear who he was. To me he was some Jersey doucher with an Affliction T-shirt and takes roids that happened to be there helping. Server seemed like he didn't want to be there. Way too dark. Calamari was overlooked. When saying thank you to server or food runner, a "yup" was said. Clearly manners and class don't rank high on priority of hiring. Menu was RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED. Pork chop for $30+!?  Unless it's from Neiman Ranch or I'm on 5th ave in the city, stop kidding yourself that it's worth over $24 for a pork chop.  Burgers are mediocre at best. Calamari was rubbery and over cooked. Asked for our food to go BC the atmosphere and servers were so sterile that we would rather eat at home. When asked to have our food to go, server seemed pissed and put-out to simply put it into a container. Long story short, the food is mediocre at best, way too overpriced, and service should all be fired and replaced with people that want to work, have a personality. Service could have saved them a bad review on here and anyone I run across, as sometimes it makes up for shortcomings. Don't waste your time here. Walk to Hoboken Bar and Grill and get twice the food quality, service, and value. Shame on you for preying on people that don't know the difference of a rip off and a upscale grill/bar.

picture this, Monday night and me and my girlfriend are craving for wings. all we wanted were wings from 10th and willow --but we live 25 minutes away and it's already 10:30 and finding parking in hoboken is like trying to find a needle in a haystack! we felt adventurous, so we took the trip. got there at 10:55 and double parked our car right next to the spot. went in, but the wings they were gone. never to fear my girlfriend is a social butterfly and we had been here before so she's cool with the bouncer. next thing i know we have wings at our table an assortment of teriyaki, bbq, and hot enough for about 3 people. and we had beer!! they took care of us and it felt good. it's a cool spot, the wings are banging! i especially love the teriyaki wings. the first time we went it was really packed, who's trying to miss out on $5 all you can eat wings and $2 draft beer? the 2nd time it was almost empty because the deal was over. they treated us really well and i have a good time each time we come here! when packed it'll be hard to find seating but if your girl is as good as mine you'll have seating in no time.
There is now a $5 cover plus 2 drink miniumum for all you can eat wings.  Still a great deal for the best wings in town, but now it's much easier to opt for MNF pizza and wings delivery instead.

Went there last night with a guest and was pleasantly surprised.  We both shared the spinach and artichoke appetizer which was tasty.  We both ordered our entrees from the specials that evening.  He had pork medallions and I had the Chilean sea bass.  Both were very impressive.  I will certainly be going back.

I do not recommend 10th & Willow to anyone who wants to drink.  We went there last night for my husband's 30th birthday to enjoy a few drinks and eat dinner at 6pm.  When we were seated at the table, an employee walked over and asked if my husband was "too drunk" to be there, while he was just watching a college football game.  We explained it was his 30th birthday and he was just hanging out.  5 minutes later, the owner/manager asked he if needed to leave, I explained that if in fact, my husband was "too drunk" to be there we would have left.  After the next few minutes of being watched like hawks, we decided to leave.  The owner than stated, "Oh! So he is too drunk to be here???", in which I explained that we were at a BAR at 6pm on a Saturday for dinner and he basically ruined the birthday dinner by interrogating the way he did.  Really?  We're at a bar, I get that you don't want wasted assholes coming in and causing problems, but seriously?  We were SITTING at a table, EATING dinner.  I will never go there again and I suggest that if you go, you probably shouldn't have any drinks, since you might be asked to leave.

I find when you get a bit off Washington or don't have the prime river view real estate, you simply have to try harder (Witness Anthony David's). 10th & Willow proves that point smartly. The best meal I've had in Hoboken. A tuna encrusted with toasted sesame seeds posessed all the nuanced flavors of a storied Manhattan bistro. A cobbler that leaves your mouth in disbelief. As for the scene inside? No clue. We ate outside. Something I reccomend after reading the somewhat disparaging remarks about the obnoxious crew indoors. We had a nice, quiet dinner. Separated from the groping, gulping interior crowd by a thick pane of insulating glass.

This place is great for lunch, brunch or dinner.  I've yet to have the wings, but I hear good things.  They do have kick ass burgers and seasoned fries.  Another plus is that they make a killer bloody mary.  This bar also has a very chill scene, whether you're there for a casual meal or to catch a game on one of their many flat screens all over the bar.  I have a feeling this is going to be a spot I catch the Giants games when football season kicks into gear.  The staff is also very attentive, from the moment you arrive until your check comes.

Ordered the spinach dip for an app. Nothing great or stood out. For the main, my girlfriend had a salad with goat cheese and shrimp. Salad was fresh and on the small size. I had a fish entree, very good, but over priced.  Overall good food, good service, slightly over priced.
